title: Advanced Single-Atom Catalyst Design Course: Integrated Computational Science and Machine Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Manipulation of atomic-level catalyst structures and visualization of machine learning models in VR environments

learning_goals: They can explain a single-atom catalyst design process that integrates first-principles calculations and machine learning.
They can analyze key descriptors used to predict nitrogen activation ability and apply them to experimental design.
They can build a workflow to evaluate the stability/activity/selectivity of V/Nb/Ta-based catalysts using VR simulation tools.
They can predict hydrogenation barriers in ammonia synthesis reactions using gradient boosting regression algorithms and analyze errors.
They can operate a high-speed computational framework for processing over 1,000 single-atom catalyst structure datasets.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
